Gravity Wave Perturbation Analysis¶

stochprop.gravity_waves.BV_freq(H)[source]¶

Compute the Brunt-Vaisala frequency defined as $N = sqrt{

rac{g}{H}}$ where

$H =

rac{rho0}{ rac{partial ho_0}{partial z}$ is the density scale height

stochprop.gravity_waves.build_spec(atmo_specification, t0=14400.0, dx=4.0, dz=0.2, Nk=128, N_om=5, ref_lat=30.0, random_phase=False)[source]¶

Function definition…

Parameters
atmo_specification: string

Atmospheric specification file path

t0: float

Reference time for gravity wave propagation (typically 4 - 6 hours)

dx: float

Horizontal wavenumber resolution [km]

dz: float

Vertical resolution for integration steps [km]

Nk: int

Horizontal wavenumber grid dimensions (Nk x Nk)

N_om: int

Frequency resolution (typically 5)

ref_lat: float

Reference latitude used to define the Coriolis frequency used as the minimum frequency

random_phase: boolean

Controls inclusion of random initial phase shifts

Returns
z_vals: 1darray

Altitudes of output

du_vals: 3darray

Zonal (E/W) wind perturbations, du(x, y, z)

dv_vals: 3darray

Meridional (N/S) wind perturbations, dv(x, y, z)

dw_vals: 3darray

Vertical wind perturbations, dw(x, y, z)

stochprop.gravity_waves.cg(k, l, om_intr, H)[source]¶

Compute the vertical group velocity for gravity wave propagation as (cg =

rac{partial hat{omega}}{partial m} = rac{m k_h N}{k_h^2 + m^2 + rac{1}{4H^2})

stochprop.gravity_waves.m_imag(k, l, om_intr, H, T0, d0)[source]¶

Compute the imaginary wave number component to add attenuation effects The imaginary component is defined as $ m_ ext{im} = -

u rac{m^3}{hat{omega}}$

where the viscosity is $

u = 3.563 imes 10^{-7} rac{T_0 left( z ight)}{ ho_0 left( z ight)}$

stochprop.gravity_waves.m_sqr(k, l, om_intr, H)[source]¶

Compute the vertical wavenumber dispersion relation for gravity wave propagation defined as m^2 =

rac{k_h^2}{hat{omega}^2} left( N^2 - hat{omega}^2 ight) + rac{1}{4 H^2}

stochprop.gravity_waves.prep(k, l, om, atmo_info, om_min, k_max)[source]¶

Identify critical layers ($ hat{omega}(z) = 0$) and turning points ($m(z) = 0$) and compute relevant quantities for the trapped GW solution. Also checks for valid Fourier component status, group velocity minimum, and other conditions that would produce a bad Fourier component

stochprop.gravity_waves.prep_wrapper(args)[source]¶
stochprop.gravity_waves.prop_upward(k, l, om, zj, t0, crit_lyr_index, turning_ht_index, w0, w_phase_prev, w_loss_prev, atmo_info, trapped_info)[source]¶

Integrate the gravity wave spectrum upward using the freely propagating solution for Fourier combinations without turning points and the Airy function form for trapped components.

stochprop.gravity_waves.prop_upward_wrapper(args)[source]¶
